content:
Diagnosis
	1. Clear cell renal cell carcinoma, right kidney
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Jan 2024 Right cytoreductive nephrectomy

	Systemic therapy
	1 Feb 2024 - Started Cabozantinib 60mg daily
	15 Mar 2024 - Dose reduction to 40mg due to grade 3 palmar-plantar syndrome
	1 Apr 2024 - Treatment discontinued due to disease progression

	Radiotherapy
	20 Mar 2024 - Whole brain radiotherapy 20Gy in 5 fractions for multiple brain metastases

	Current disease status
	Progressive disease with deteriorating clinical status

	Current issues
	Worsening bone pain
	Increasing fatigue
	Decreased oral intake
	Neurological symptoms from brain metastases

	Summary of consultation

I reviewed [redacted name] today, who attended with her husband. Unfortunately, she has experienced significant clinical deterioration over the past three weeks. Her performance status has declined from ECOG 2 to 3, spending more than 50% of time in bed. She describes worsening bone pain particularly affecting her thoracic spine and left hip, despite recent increases in opiate analgesia. Her neurological symptoms have also progressed with increasing headaches and mild right-sided weakness, though she remains independently mobile with a walking frame.

She has developed significant fatigue limiting her daily activities and reports poor appetite with 4kg weight loss over the past month. She is struggling with ongoing nausea, though denies any frank vomiting. The palmar-plantar syndrome which previously required Cabozantinib dose reduction has now resolved following treatment discontinuation.

On examination, she appears cachectic with obvious muscle wasting. There is tenderness over T8-T10 vertebrae. Neurological examination reveals mild right-sided weakness (4+/5) but preserved reflexes and sensation. Recent CT shows progressive disease with enlarging liver metastases and new pulmonary nodules. MRI brain demonstrates enlarging metastases despite whole brain radiotherapy.

	Further investigations
	Urgent MRI spine to assess for cord compression
	Blood tests including LFTs, bone profile, and clotting

	Medication changes
	Morphine modified release increased to 60mg BD
	Dexamethasone 8mg daily commenced
	Metoclopramide 10mg TDS added

	Follow up
	Urgent palliative care review arranged for tomorrow
	Next oncology review in 1 week

	Required actions
	Referral completed to community palliative care team
	District nurse referral for support at home
	Urgent SALT assessment requested for swallowing assessment

primary_cancer.metastases: multiple brain metastases, bone metastases affecting thoracic spine and left hip, liver metastases, pulmonary nodules

cancer_timeline.value: Cabozantinib dose reduction to 40mg due to grade 3 palmar-plantar syndrome
Whole brain radiotherapy 20Gy in 5 fractions for multiple brain metastases
Cabozantinib discontinued due to disease progression
CT shows progressive disease with enlarging liver metastases and new pulmonary nodules
MRI brain demonstrates enlarging metastases despite whole brain radiotherapy

patient_facts.value: ECOG PS 3, spending more than 50% of time in bed
Worsening bone pain affecting thoracic spine and left hip
Poor appetite with 4kg weight loss over past month
Mild right-sided weakness (4+/5) but preserved reflexes and sensation

status_updates.value: Metastatic renal cell carcinoma with progressive disease following failed first-line therapy. Significant clinical deterioration with declining performance status and increasing symptom burden
Progressive disease with enlarging liver metastases, new pulmonary nodules, and enlarging brain metastases
Cabozantinib discontinued due to disease progression, focus on supportive care
Deterioration in performance status from ECOG 2 to 3, now bed-bound >50% of time
Urgent MRI spine to assess for cord compression
Urgent palliative care review arranged for tomorrow, oncology review in 1 week
